featured.text: As a result, the astronauts have swollen, puffy faces, very much resembling that of the round-headed Charlie Brown in the famous comic strip.
Arms extending horizontally commanded drivers to stop, whereas arms lowered to a 45-degree angle told drivers to move on, resembling a traffic director’s gestures.
An eye stye is a small bump, resembling a pimple, that develops when an oil gland at the edge of an eyelid becomes infected by bacteria.
Phones resembling the wind phone have since been built around the world.
The innovative footwear resembles a common sandal and is made of leather straps and rubber soles, a material similar to that used in tires.

definition.en_def: To have a similar appearance or qualities to someone or something.
definition.example: She resembles her mother in both looks and personality.
